availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John M. Jackson (Hickman County, Kentucky, physician.)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, physician. Tennessee native. Married to Martha T. Johns Jackson in Hickman County, Kentucky, in May 1849. Father of Virginia Marietta Jackson. Physician in Mississippi County, Missouri, in 1850. Physician in Hickman County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Hickman County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Missouri, Mississippi County, District 57, p. 460B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 467.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 205B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Columbus, p. 425B.
Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954, Genealogical Society of Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT, Hickman County Marriages, Film 000321384.
"Dr John M Jackson (1830-1896)," Find A Grave, Memorial 114439659, accessed November 6, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/114439659.
